skill.name: docs-review
skill.description: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewing pull requests, files, or diffs containing documentation markdown files.
skill.summary: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewin...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation review skill. Uses only read-only tools (Read, Grep, Bash, Glob). No scripts, network calls, code execution, or filesystem access beyond reading documentation files.

content.value_statement: Documentation reviews require careful attention to style guidelines. This skill automates consistency checks against the Metabase writing style guide for pull requests and markdown files.
actual_capabilities: Detects formal or corporate language in documentation
Checks structure and clarity of headings and paragraphs
Reviews link text for descriptive accuracy
Supports both local review and GitHub PR workflows
Numbers all issues sequentially for easy reference
limitations: Limited to markdown documentation files only
Cannot execute code or verify code examples directly
Cannot access private repositories without proper authentication
Only checks against Metabase style guide rules

use_cases.title: PR documentation review
use_cases.description: Review pull request documentation changes for style guide compliance before merging

use_cases.title: Contrib guide compliance
use_cases.description: Ensure community contributions follow documentation standards

use_cases.title: Quality consistency checks
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent writing style across large documentation projects

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review the changes in this pull request for style guide compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Local file review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review the documentation file at [filepath] for style guide issues.

prompt_templates.title: Diff review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review these diff changes and identify all style guide violations.

prompt_templates.title: Full review with fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to perform a thorough review and provide specific suggestions for each issue found.

output_examples.input: Review the documentation changes in this PR for style guide compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone - Line 15: Consider 'You cannot' ‚Üí 'You can't' for a conversational tone
Issue 2: Vague heading - Line 8: 'Upgrade process' ‚Üí 'Run migrations before upgrading' states the actual point
Issue 3: Link text - Line 23: 'click here' ‚Üí Use descriptive link text like 'read the installation guide'

best_practices: Use the numbered issue format to reference specific feedback items
Only flag issues that make a material difference to the reader
In PR mode, post all comments in parallel for a cohesive review
anti_patterns: Flagging trivial issues that do not impact readability
Skipping important style violations for minor ones
Posting PR comments one at a time instead of in parallel

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Read, Grep, Bash, and Glob tools.

faq.question: What file types can it review?
faq.answer: Only markdown documentation files. Does not review code, configuration, or other file types.

faq.question: Does it modify files?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and reviews. It suggests fixes but never writes changes to files.

faq.question: Can it review private repositories?
faq.answer: It can review any file it has read access to. Authentication is handled by the host AI tool.

faq.question: Does it check code examples?
faq.answer: It reviews code example formatting but cannot execute or validate that code examples work correctly.

faq.question: How is this different from other docs tools?
faq.answer: It enforces the specific Metabase writing style guide rather than generic markdown linting rules.
